text: it's been perhaps the most turbulent
year in Turkey's modern history from an
attempted coup to a wave of terror
attacks to conflict with the Kurdish
minority this is the story of a
traumatic 12 months the backdrop has
been the insurgency in the southeast
since a ceasefire broke down with the
PKK a Kurdish militants there's been
tit-for-tat violence the PKK have blown
up soldiers and police the state has
attacked and imposed curfews two and a
half thousand have died including
civilians and half a million are
displaced malik el bast√≥n sister ESMA
fought with the PKK and was killed her
body was retrieved after six months each
team is she faced discrimination for
being the other and occurred and she
solved the massacres of last year that's
how she emerged as a fighter we don't
care if the government calls her a
terrorist its state tourism against the
people who have found people burned
alive in basements and bodies abandoned
for weeks this regime has blood on his
hands Kurdish militants and so-called
Islamic state have bombed across the
country this year I asked behind the
Istanbul Airport attack in June 360
people have died in 22 terror attacks
this year the latest this month by
Kurdish militants killing more than 40
people outside beshi - football stadium
in Istanbul Tunch undrew was among them
a lifelong bishop - fan he worked at the
stadium his mother called him a rose
band when I got the news I collapsed
well they showed him his body at the
hospital I kissed him and then we buried
him may God spare everyone else this
pain may there be peace for Turkey and
no more bloodshed
the defining moment of the year came in
July rebel soldiers bombed Parliament
and drove tanks into civilians in an
attempted coup it failed but at least
265 people were killed tens of thousands
were arrested and dismissed charged with
links to the plotters lawyer fatty jun
by went out that night to resist the
coup he since represented some of those
caught up in the purge was shocking we
couldn't tolerate it it was like
something precious was being forcefully
taken away from us
if the coup had succeeded it would have
been far worse but I have friends in
prison who had nothing to do with it
there was an attempt to steal our lives
that night but while on a smaller scale
we are facing a similar attempt now so
what of the mood here this is a defiant
nation but an anxious and divided one
too and as president aired one tries to
enhance his powers next year through
constitutional change that could deepen
political polarization 2017 could be a
year in which turkey lurches between yet
more crises
mark Lowen BBC News Istanbul
